bibl.title: Letter from C.H. Bridges to Mabel H. Lazear, March 6, 1930

div1.p: Bridges informs Mabel Lazear that Jesse Lazear's name is now on the Roll of Honor.

div1.head: Letter from C.H. Bridges to Mabel H. Lazear, March 6, 1930
div1.opener:
SSL-AWO
IN REPLY
REFER TO
A.G. 005.6 (3-6-30) Pub.
WAR DEPARTMENT
THE ADJUTANT GENERAL'S OFFICE
WASHINGTON
March 6, 1930.
Mrs. Jesse W. Lazear,
6 Oak Vale Avenue,
Berkeley, Calif.
Dear Madam:
div1.p:
I have the honor to advise you that the name of your
husband, Dr. Jesse W. Lazear, appears on the Roll of Honor published
in the Official Army Register for 1930, pursuant to the provisions
of the Act of Congress approved February 28, 1929, (Public No. 858 -
70th Congress). Believing that you will be interested, a copy of the
Register has been mailed to you under separate cover.
div1.closer:
Very truly yours, C. H. Bridges
Major General,
The Adjutant General. By A.J.B.
